wallet.backup.privacy.warning.dialog.che: Please make sure nobody looks into your screen unless you want them to have access to your funds.
wallet.backup.privacy.warning.dialog.rec: On the following screen, you will see a 12-word phrase. This is your wallet backup phrase. It can be entered in any version of Daedalus in order to restore your wallet.
wallet.backup.recovery.phrase.display.di: The phrase is case sensitive. Please make sure you write down and save your recovery phrase. You will need this phrase to use and restore your wallet.
Yes, I have written it down.
wallet.backup.recovery.phrase.entry.dial: I understand that my wallet and tokens are held securely only on this device only and not on any servers.
I understand that if this application is moved to another device or is deleted, my wallet can be only recovered with the backup phrase that I have written down and saved in a secure place
Tap each word in the correct order to verify your recovery phrase

wallet.redeem.dialog.certificateHint: Drop the file with your certificate here or click to find on your computer
wallet.redeem.dialog.headline: Ada Redemption
wallet.redeem.dialog.instructions:
To redeem your Ada upload your certificate or copy and paste your redemption code from the certificate. Here is an example redemption key, yours will look similar:

B_GQOAffMBeRIn6vh1hJmeOT3ViS_TmaT4XAHAfDVH0=

If you upload a PDF file with your certificate redemption code will be automatically extracted.

If you upload encrypted certificate you will need to provide a 9 word mnemonic passphrase to decrypt your certificate and your redemption code will be automatically extracted.
